title: People can expect changes that will affect several aspects, from where they visit to how they get there
description: As the world ground to a halt last March, many travelers expected to be globetrotting again in a few months time.

title: Did Tanzania's Covid-denying leader die of the coronavirus?
Dad mics up his skiing toddler, captures her adorable pep talks
description: Three-year-old Adia Leidums speeds down mountains on her tiny toddler skis in Fernie, British Columbia. Her parents Erich and Courtney say they're teaching her to ski at a young age in order to build her confidence and resiliency.

title: Sign at Texas restaurant threatens a $50 fee 'If I have to explain why masks are mandatory'
description: The owners of a Denton, Texas, diner want customers to know that they are serious when they say masks are still required in their establishment.

title: Louisiana is holding a special election today. Here's who is on the ballot
description: The first congressional elections of the 2022 midterm cycle are set for Saturday, when Louisiana voters go to the polls to fill a pair of vacancies in the state's House delegation.

title: Spring equinox 2021: Hope on the horizon
description: For people in the Northern Hemisphere who huddled against a sometimes brutal winter, hope is here. Spring equinox 2021 arrives on Saturday, March 20, bringing its nearly perfect balance of daytime and nighttime all around the world.

title: Analysis: No vaccines, no leadership, no end in sight. How Brazil became a global threat
description: The temperature read 95 degrees Fahrenheit on Tuesday, but the humidity made it feel worse. Amid the stifling late summer Rio de Janeiro heat, Silvia Silva Santos steadied her 77-year-old mother as they walked toward the clinic gate.

title: Police seize real gun disguised as Nerf toy in drug raid
description: Police in North Carolina found a real gun disguised as a Nerf toy while conducting a drug raid in Catawba County, north of Charlotte, this week.

title: Imran Khan tests positive for Covid, days after getting vaccine
description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan has tested positive for Covid-19 and is "self-isolating at home," the country's health minister, Faisal Sultan, said on Saturday.

title: Finnish astrophotographer spends 12 years creating a Milky Way mosaic
description: Capturing panoramas of the Milky Way, the galaxy in which we reside, might seem like a daunting task considering it is, according to the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, about 100,000 light-years across.

title: Investigations into Cuomo heat up as new controversies arise
description: After stiff-arming calls for his resignation from leading state Democratic lawmakers, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is staking his political fate on the outcome of a pair of independent investigations into allegations he sexually harassed or behaved inappropriately toward several women.

title: Elsa Peretti, famed Tiffany & Co. jewelry designer, dies at 80
description: Elsa Peretti, the famed jewelry designer for Tiffany & Co., has died, according to a statement from the company. She was 80 years old.

title: Biden administration off to a combative start with tough rhetoric on Russia, China
description: President Joe Biden didn't waste a beat when asked this week whether he believed his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin was a "killer."

title: A more contagious coronavirus variant is spreading across the US. Can vaccines stop it?
description: A new, more contagious and potentially more deadly variant of the coronavirus is spreading across the US, and health officials are worried.

title: These are the ways of voting Republicans are trying to limit
description: Republicans' response to losing control of the White House and Senate has been to try and make voting harder in a number of states. Most notably, perhaps, is Georgia, where they're going after ways of voting that were popular for Black voters and Democrats in 2020 (e.g. mail voting).

title: What's a filibuster? Democrats may finally ax a relic of racist past
description: You're going to start to hear a lot more about Democrats' efforts to end the filibuster in the US Senate. If successful, it'll be an important move supported by good-government advocates as well as political progressives who want to defrost the levers of government and make them work in a big way instead of in increments.

title: Quake in Japan near devastating 2011 disaster epicenter
description: A tsunami warning has been issued following an earthquake off the east coast of Japan, the US National Tsunami Warning Center reported on Saturday.

title: Spring, the most inspiring of the seasons (this year especially)
description: As the end of the pandemic tunnel gets brighter and brighter, has a season ever better aligned with where most people are in the world right now?

title: Iceland volcano remains hazardous after eruption near Reykjavík
description: Iceland has reported a volcanic eruption on the south-west Reykjanes Peninsula, the Icelandic Meteorological Office (IMO) tweeted Friday.

title: Soccer sex abuse scandal: Report is 'kick in the teeth' for survivors, says Paul Stewart
description: Paul Stewart played for the England international team and some of English football's leading clubs, notably Manchester City, Tottenham Hotspur and Liverpool.

title: Entire house floats away as flash floods batter Australia's east coast
description: Australia's east coast was smashed by heavy rains on Saturday, sparking dangerous flash flooding that forced the evacuation of multiple regions as the fast-moving waters unmoored houses, engulfed roads, stranded towns and cut power lines.

title: More than 300 million people will celebrate Nowruz (and you should, too)
description: For millions of people across the globe, Nowruz is no small celebration. Think Christmas, New Year's and Fourth of July combined -- and add to it fire festivities, delicious meats, rice and spices, family gatherings, street dances and loud banging on pots.

title: A company will pay you $2,400 to stay away from screens for 24 hours
description: Doom-scrolling getting you down?

title: She spent 18 years in jail for killing all four of her babies. But science suggests that's not what happened
description: Kathleen Folbigg has spent the past 18 years in prison for one of the most horrific crimes imaginable: killing all four of her babies.

title: Glory days of Trump's gold-plated 757 seem far away as plane sits idle at sleepy airport
description: Trump's personal Boeing 757 was always the crown jewel of his wealth -- the ultimate sign that he had made it. He's used it as a backdrop for sleek photo shoots, campaign rallies, VIP tours, for shots of him eating his Big Macs and KFC, plated, with a knife and fork. Trump loved to show it off -- the customized cream-colored leather seats, gilded bathrooms, the seat buckles layered in 24-karat gold.

title: Why the 911 will be last the Porsche model to go electric
description: Porsche is making a big push to go green. By 2030, the high-performance automaker says it will be "carbon neutral" and that 80% of the cars and SUV it makes will either be electric or plug-in hybrids.

title: Wisconsin voters weigh in on Sen. Ron Johnson
description: CNN's Sara Murray takes a look at Sen. Ron Johnson (R-WI) and how voters in the state feel about his comments surrounding the riot at the Capitol, and the possibility that he will run for reelection in 2022.

title: Prince Harry invokes his mother's memory in foreword to new book
description: Prince Harry has revealed how the death of his mother, Diana, Princess of Wales, affected him in a new book to support grieving children and young people who have lost loved ones in the pandemic.
